description:
As a poker game system
  I want to execute a complete 5-player Texas Hold'em game
  So that I can validate complex multi-player game mechanics with specific card dealing and betting patterns

steps.name: the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
I have 5 players ready to join a poker game
all players have starting stacks of $100
players join the table in order:
all players should be seated correctly:
I manually start the game for table 1
the game starts with blinds structure:
the pot should be $3
hole cards are dealt according to the test scenario:
each player should see their own hole cards
the pre-flop betting round begins
Player3 raises to $6
Player4 calls $6
Player5 folds
Player1 calls $5 more
Player2 re-raises to $16
Player3 calls $10 more
Player4 folds
Player1 folds
the pot should be $41
2 players should remain in the hand: Player2, Player3
the flop is dealt: K♣, Q♥, 10♦
Player2 checks
Player3 bets $20
Player2 calls $20
the pot should be $81
both players should see the 3 flop cards
Player2 should have top pair with Q♥
Player3 should have top pair with K♣ and straight draw potential

elements.name: Complete 5-Player Texas Hold'em Game with Specific Cards and Actions

steps.name: the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
I have 5 players ready to join a poker game
all players have starting stacks of $100
players join the table in order:
all players should be seated correctly:
I manually start the game for table 1
the game starts with blinds structure:
the pot should be $3
the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
a 5-player game is in progress
hole cards are dealt according to the test scenario:
each player should see their own hole cards
each player should see 2 face-down cards for other players
the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
hole cards have been dealt to 5 players
the pot is $3 from blinds
the pre-flop betting round begins
Player3 raises to $6
Player4 calls $6
Player5 folds
Player1 calls $5 more (completing small blind call)
Player2 re-raises to $16
Player3 calls $10 more
Player4 folds
Player1 folds
the pot should be $41
2 players should remain in the hand: Player2, Player3
Player4 should have $94 remaining
Player1 should have $93 remaining
Player5 should have $100 remaining
the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
2 players remain after pre-flop: Player2, Player3
the pot is $41
the flop is dealt: K♠, Q♠, 10♥
Player2 checks
Player3 bets $20
Player2 calls $20
the pot should be $81
both players should see the 3 flop cards
Player2 should have top pair with Q♥
Player3 should have top pair with K♣ and straight draw potential
the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
the flop betting is complete with pot at $81
the turn card J♥ is dealt
Player2 bets $30
Player3 raises to $60
Player2 goes all-in for $54 total remaining
Player3 calls the remaining $24
the pot should be $195
Player2 should be all-in
Player3 should have chips remaining
Player2 should have two pair potential
Player3 should have two pair: K♣ and J♠
the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
both players are committed to showdown
the pot is $195
the river card 8♥ is dealt
the final board should be: K♠, Q♠, 10♥, J♥, 8♥
the showdown should occur automatically
the poker system is running
I have a clean game state
the card order is deterministic for testing
the showdown occurs with final board: K♠, Q♠, 10♥, J♥, 8♥

cells: K♣, K♠, J♣, J♥, Q♠ (Two Pair)

steps.name: hands are evaluated:
Player2 should win with "Ace-high flush"
Player2 should receive the pot of $195
the action history should show the complete game sequence

the card order is deterministic for testing
the game is complete
final stacks are calculated
the stack distribution should be:
the total chips should remain $500
the game state should be ready for a new hand
